abstract_summ: Thus, ferrets represent an infection and transmission animal model of COVID-19 that may facilitate development of SARS-CoV-2 therapeutics and vaccines.Many scientific questions about SARS-CoV-2 and COVID-19 were raised and urgently need to be answered, including the susceptibility of animals to SARS-CoV-2 infection.Here we tested whether tree shrew, an emerging experimental animal domesticated from wild animal, is susceptible to SARS-CoV-2 infection.Here, we show that African green monkeys support a high level of SARS-CoV-2 replication and develop pronounced respiratory disease that may be more substantial than reported for other NHP species including cynomolgus and rhesus macaques.Pulmonary infiltrates, a hallmark of human disease, were visible in lung radiographs of all animals.
title_summ: Respiratory disease in rhesus macaques inoculated with SARS-CoV-2.Comparison of SARS-CoV-2 infections among 3 species of non-human primatesSusceptibility of tree shrew to SARS-CoV-2 infectionPathogenesis, transmission and response to re-exposure of SARS-CoV-2 in domestic catsOcular conjunctival inoculation of SARS-CoV-2 can cause mild COVID-19 in Rhesus macaquesInfection and Rapid Transmission of SARS-CoV-2 in FerretsEstablishment of an African green monkey model for COVID-19Infectivity, virulence, pathogenicity, host-pathogen interactions of SARS and SARS-CoV-2 in experimental animals: a systematic reviewRespiratory disease and virus shedding in rhesus macaques inoculated with SARS-CoV-2Infection with novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) causes pneumonia in Rhesus macaques.Pathogenesis and transmission of SARS-CoV-2 in golden hamsters.Syrian hamsters as a small animal model for SARS-CoV-2 infection and countermeasure development.
title_abstract_phrases: Our results suggest that SARS-CoV-2 infection in golden Syrian hamsters resemble features found in humans with mild infections.Many scientific questions about SARS-CoV-2 and COVID-19 were raised and urgently need to be answered, including the susceptibility of animals to SARS-CoV-2 infection.Here we tested whether tree shrew, an emerging experimental animal domesticated from wild animal, is susceptible to SARS-CoV-2 infection.Thus, ferrets represent an infection and transmission animal model of COVID-19 that may facilitate development of SARS-CoV-2 therapeutics and vaccines.Here, we show that African green monkeys support a high level of SARS-CoV-2 replication and develop pronounced respiratory disease that may be more substantial than reported for other NHP species including cynomolgus and rhesus macaques.
